alert.note: Alert for Lewis (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 01 at 3:48PM PST until March 02 at 11:06AM PST by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Washington... White River At R Street Bridge affecting King and Pierce Counties. Cowlitz River At Randle affecting Lewis County. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Washington... Deschutes River Near Rainier affecting Thurston County. South Prairie Creek at South Prairie affecting Pierce County. .Showers will diminish today and will not contribute to rising river levels. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Cowlitz River At Randle. * WHEN...Until late tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 18.0 feet, the Cowlitz River will cause minor flooding from the vicinity of Randle downstream through Riffe Lake...covering nearby farm lands and several roads. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:15 PM PST Tuesday the stage was 19.5 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 3:15 PM PST Tuesday was 19.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 19.5 feet late this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage just after midnight tonight. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 19.4 feet on 11/09/1995. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. Most flood related deaths occur in automobiles. Do not attempt to cross water covered bridges, dips, or low water crossings. Never try to cross a flowing stream, even a small one, on foot. To escape rising water find another route over higher ground. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by this evening at 1145 PM PST.
